â
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}}, {{lse|GGEA}}) is an American public corporation specializing in [[Google search|Internet search]]. It also generates profits from [[AdWords|advertising]] bought on its similarly free-to-user [[Gmail|e-mail]], [[Google Maps|online mapping]], [[Google Apps|office productivity]], [[Orkut|social networking]] and [[YouTube|video-sharing]] services. [[Google Search Appliance|Advert-free versions]] are available via paid subscription. Google has more recently developed an [[open source]] [[Google Chrome|web browser]] and a [[Android (operating system)|mobile phone operating system]]. Its headquarters, often referred to as the [[Googleplex]], is located in [[Mountain View, California]]. {{As of|2009|03|31|df=US}}, the company had 19,786 full-time employees. It runs thousands of servers across the world, processing millions of search requests each day and about one [[petabyte]] of user-generated data each hour.<ref name="googlopoly">"[http://www.wired.com/techbiz/it/magazine/17-08/mf_googlopoly?currentPage=all Why Is Obama's Top Antitrust Cop Gunning for Google?]". ''[[Wired Magazine]]''. 20. July, 2009. Retrieved on July 21, 2009.</ref>
+
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}}, {{lse|GGEA}}) is an American public [[corporation]], specializing in [[Google search|Internet search]], that hosts a number of [[Internet]]-based services and products. The company generates profits primarily from [[advertising]] through its [[AdWords]] program, which is diplayed on its free of cost [[Gmail]] [[e-mail]] service, [[Google Maps|online mapping]] service, [[Google Apps]] office productivity program, [[YouTube]] [[video-sharing]] website, and [[List of Google products|more]].<ref name="financialtables">{{cite web |url=http://investor.google.com/fin_data.html |title=Financial Tables |publisher=Google Investor Relations |accessdate=2008-01-31}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Online Ads Give Google Huge Gain in Profit |author=David A. Vise |url=David A. Vise |newspaper=The Washington Post |date=2005-10-21 |accessdate=2010-02-14}}</ref> Google has also developed an [[open source]] [[web browser]] named [[Google Chrome]], and the [[Android (operating system)|Android]] [[mobile phone]] [[operating system]], used on a number of [[HTC]] phones such as the [[Nexus One]]. Its headquarters, often referred to as the [[Googleplex]] derived from the number [[googolplex]], is located in [[Mountain View, California]]. {{As of|2009|03|31|df=US}}, the company had 19,786 full-time employees. It runs thousands of servers across the world, processing millions of search requests each day and about one [[petabyte]] of user-generated data each hour.<ref name="googlopoly">"[http://www.wired.com/techbiz/it/magazine/17-08/mf_googlopoly?currentPage=all Why Is Obama's Top Antitrust Cop Gunning for Google?]". ''[[Wired Magazine]]''. 20. July, 2009. Retrieved on July 21, 2009.</ref> Even the company's name, Google, was a play on the large number [[googol]] to represent the large amount of information the company set out to organize. <ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.google.com/corporate/history.html |title=Google Milestones |publisher=Google Inc. |accessdate=14 February 2010}}</ref>
Google was founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while students at [[Stanford University]]. It was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on September 4, 1998. The [[initial public offering]] was on August 19, 2004. It raised [[United States dollar|$]]1.67 billion, implying a total value of $23 billion. Google's rapid growth has sparked a sequence of new products, [[List of Google acquisitions|acquisitions]] and [[Google#Partnerships|partnerships]] beyond its core [[search engine]]. [[Google#Environmentalism|Environmentalism]], [[Google.org|philanthropy]] and [[Google#Corporate affairs and culture|positive employee relations]] were from the start assigned an important role in establishing [[brand image]]. Google has been repeatedly named [[Fortune Magazine]]'s ''Number One Best Place to Work''<ref name="best_company">"[http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fortune/bestcompanies/2007/full_list/ 100 Best Companies to Work For 2007]". ''[[Fortune Magazine]] (link published by [[CNN]])''. 22 January 2007. Retrieved on January 8, 2007.</ref> and ''most powerful brand in the world''.<ref>[http://www.millwardbrown.com/Sites/optimor/Media/Pdfs/en/BrandZ/BrandZ-2008-Report.pdf BrandZ Top 100 2008 Report] (PDF)</ref> [[Alexa Internet|Alexa]] lists Google as the Internet's most visited website.<ref>{{cite web | title = Alexa Traffic Rank for Google (three month average)|author=| publisher = [[Alexa Internet]]| url =http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/google.com|accessdate= 2009-09-06}}</ref>
Google was founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while students at [[Stanford University]]. It was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on September 4, 1998. The [[initial public offering]] was on August 19, 2004. It raised [[United States dollar|$]]1.67 billion, implying a total value of $23 billion. Google's rapid growth has sparked a sequence of new products, [[List of Google acquisitions|acquisitions]] and [[Google#Partnerships|partnerships]] beyond its core [[search engine]]. [[Google#Environmentalism|Environmentalism]], [[Google.org|philanthropy]] and [[Google#Corporate affairs and culture|positive employee relations]] were from the start assigned an important role in establishing [[brand image]]. Google has been repeatedly named [[Fortune Magazine]]'s ''Number One Best Place to Work''<ref name="best_company">"[http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fortune/bestcompanies/2007/full_list/ 100 Best Companies to Work For 2007]". ''[[Fortune Magazine]] (link published by [[CNN]])''. 22 January 2007. Retrieved on January 8, 2007.</ref> and ''most powerful brand in the world''.<ref>[http://www.millwardbrown.com/Sites/optimor/Media/Pdfs/en/BrandZ/BrandZ-2008-Report.pdf BrandZ Top 100 2008 Report] (PDF)</ref> [[Alexa Internet|Alexa]] lists Google as the Internet's most visited website.<ref>{{cite web | title = Alexa Traffic Rank for Google (three month average)|author=| publisher = [[Alexa Internet]]| url =http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/google.com|accessdate= 2009-09-06}}</ref>
